pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, September 15, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, September 15, 2017:

Montréal, Quebec

10:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a roundtable discussion and will deliver remarks at an event hosted by Facebook AI Research (FAIR).

McGill Faculty Club and Conference Centre
3450 McTavish Street

Notes for media:

  • Media should arrive no later than 10:15 a.m. and should RSVP to dtroya-alvarez@argylepr.com
  • Photo opportunity at beginning of the roundtable at 10:45 a.m. and open coverage for remarks at 11:30 a.m.

1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the Prime Minister of the Republic of Fiji, Frank Bainimarama.

McGill Faculty Cluband Conference Centre
3450 McTavish Street

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at beginning of the meeting
  • Media should present themselves at the Maude Abbott Room on the 2nd floor no later than 12:45 p.m.

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in an armchair discussion at the Canada 2020 Global Progress Summit.

Le Centre Sheraton Montréal Hotel, Main Ballroom
1201 René-Lévesque Boulevard West

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should present themselves at the East Ballroom no later than 2:00 p.m.

3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a Roundtable Ministerial Meeting on Climate Change with the Minister of Environment and Climate Change, Catherine McKenna.

W Montréal Hotel
901 Rue du Square-Victoria

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting
  • Media should arrive no later than 3:00 p.m.

Waterloo, Ontario

8:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks at the opening ceremony of the Hack the North Conference.

Hagey Hall
University of Waterloo
200 University Avenue West

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 7:45 p.m. and should register at: press@hackthenorth.com
  • Upon arrival, media should check in at parking lot B, E5 tent
